questions.question: For each of the following, choose the sentence with the correct comma placement.

choices.answer: I took Angie, the one with the freckles to the movies.
I took Angie, the one with the freckles, to the movies.
I took Angie the one with the freckles, to the movies.
I took Angie, the one with the freckles, to the movies.

questions.question: For each of the following, choose the sentence with the correct comma placement.

choices.answer: Jeremy, and I, have had our share of arguments.
Jeremy and I, have had our share of arguments.
Jeremy and I have had our share of arguments.
Jeremy and I have had, our share of arguments.

questions.question: For each of the following, choose the sentence with the correct comma placement.

choices.answer: I need, sugar, butter, and eggs from the grocery store.
I need sugar, butter, and eggs, from the grocery store.
I need: sugar, butter, and eggs from the grocery store.
I need sugar, butter, and eggs from the grocery store.

questions.question: Where should the commas go?  Select the most correct response.

choices.answer: Chelsea's paintings include red, orange, yellow, & purple.
Chelsea's paintings include red, orange yellow and purple.
Chelsea's paintings include, red, orange yellow and purple.
Chelsea's paintings include red, orange, yellow & purple.

questions.question: Where do the COMMAS go?  Select the most correct sentence.

choices.answer: I can go to the park with you but I have to do my HW first.
I can go to the park, with you, but I have to do my HW first
I can go to the park with you, but I have to do my HW first.
I can go, to the park, with you but I have to do my HW first

questions.question: Which of these sentences uses COMMAS correctly?

choices.answer: The war is over, and all of the troops will be coming home.
The war, is over, & all of the troops will be coming home.
The war is over and all of the troops will be coming home.
The war is over, and all of the troops, will be coming home.

questions.question: Which of these sentences uses COMMAS correctly?

choices.answer: He grew up in Richmond, Va., and would like to return.
He grew up in Richmond, Va. and would like to return.
He grew up in Richmond Va. and would like to go back.
He grew up in Richmond, Va, and would like to go back.

questions.question: Which of these sentences uses COMMAS correctly?

choices.answer: The museum had many, remarkable holdings including a Picasso
The museum had many remarkable holdings including a Picasso
The museum had many remarkable holdings, including a Picasso
The museum had many, remarkable holdings, including Picasso

questions.question: What punctuation is missing? "Jo ate all the food"

choices.answer: Exclamation mark
Capital letter
Full stop (Period)
Question mark

questions.question: Which sentence is the MOST correct?

choices.answer: I am going to the market then I will meet my friends.
I am going. To the market then I will meet my friends
I am going to the market.  Then, I will meet my friends.
I am going to the market. Then I will meet my friends.

questions.question: Which of these sentences uses commas correctly?

choices.answer: I would have to say, frankly that I don’t agree.
I would have to say frankly that I don’t agree.
I would have to say, frankly, that I don’t agree.
I would have to say frankly that, I don’t agree.

questions.question: Which of these sentences uses commas correctly?

choices.answer: At the beginning of the game the score, is always tied.
At the beginning, of the game, the score is always tied.
At the beginning of the game the score is always tied.
At the beginning of the game, the score is always tied.
